doc.field: Row of apostles on <a href"http:www.european-traveler.comfrancevisit-amiens-cathedral-largest-gothic-church-france" rel"nofollow">Amiens Cathedral<a>.
france picardie somme amiens amienscathedral cathédralenotredamedamiens gothic church cathedral

<a href"http:www.european-traveler.comfrancevisit-amiens-cathedral-largest-gothic-church-france" rel"nofollow">Amiens Cathedral<a> is the largest Gothic church in France. It has a magnificent western facade with three portals. The Last Judgment is the theme on the tympanum of the central portal, the life of St Frimin, who brought Christianity to this part of France in the 4th century is on the left (north) portal and Mary, Mother of Christ, on the right (south) doorway. The row of 22 kings are below the huge rose window, as the height of the nave required this window to be very high too. The north tower is at 68 m equal in height to the towers of Notre Dame de Paris, while the south tower is at 62 m just 6 m higher than the top of the roof of the nave. The steeple above the crossing is 112.7 m tall.
france church cathedral gothic amiens picardie somme amienscathedral cathédralenotredamedamiens vision:mountain0615 vision:outdoor0964 vision:sky0858
